list_definition.definition: anything growing from the ground, having a stem, a root and leaves
to put (something) into the ground so that it will grow

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We have planted vegetables in the garden.

list_definition.definition: to make (a garden etc); to cause (a garden etc) to have (plants etc) growing in it

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The garden was planted with shrubs
We’re going to plant an orchard.
He planted himself between her and the door.

list_definition.definition: to put in someone’s possession, especially as false evidence

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He claimed that the police had planted the weapon on his brother.
